= Worker or Threaded server POSIX Limit Configuration

This config section convert environment variable related to worker or threaded server posix limit configuration to valid odoo CLI.

include::partial$converters/process_limit.adoc[]


[[option_limit_request]]
== limit_request
Maximum number of request to be processed per worker (default 65536).

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_REQUEST` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-request

[[option_limit_time_cpu]]
== limit_time_cpu
Maximum allowed CPU time per request (default 60).

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_TIME_CPU` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-time-cpu

[[option_limit_time_real]]
== limit_time_real
Maximum allowed Real time per request in seconds (default 120).

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_TIME_REAL` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-time-real

[[option_limit_time_real_cron]]
== limit_time_real_cron
Maximum allowed Real time per cron job. (default: --limit-time-real). Set to 0 for no limit.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_TIME_REAL_CRON` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-time-real-cron

[[option_osv_memory_count_limit]]
== osv_memory_count_limit
Force a limit on the maximum number of records kept in the virtual osv_memory tables.
         By default there is no limit.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `TRANSIENT_COUNT_LIMIT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --osv-memory-count-limit

[[option_transient_age_limit]]
== transient_age_limit
Time limit (decimal value in hours) records created with a TransientModel (mostly wizard)
        are kept in the database. Default to 1 hour.For prior version see osv_memory_age_limit

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 14.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `TRANSIENT_AGE_LIMIT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_float[float].

Odoo cli used:

* --transient-age-limit

[NOTE]
====
Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 13.0 this key used the cli `--osv-memory-age-limit`
====

[[option_limit_memory_hard]]
== limit_memory_hard
Maximum allowed virtual memory per worker (in bytes), when reached,
         any memory allocation will fail (default 2560MiB).

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_MEMORY_HARD` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-memory-hard

[[option_limit_memory_soft]]
== limit_memory_soft
Maximum allowed virtual memory per worker (in bytes),
         when reached the worker be reset after the current request (default 2048MiB).

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_MEMORY_SOFT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-memory-soft

[[option_limit_time_worker_cron]]
== limit_time_worker_cron
Maximum time a cron thread/worker stays alive before it is restarted. Set to 0 to disable. (default: 0)

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 16.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIMIT_TIME_WORKER_CRON` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --limit-time-worker-cron
